content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5) and a Dedicated Output Chest at (0.5, 2.5)
– Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5)
– Common Input Chest (Wooden Chest) at (2.5, 0.5)
– New Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5)
– Transport Belt Connection linking mining output to the feeder inserter

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5)
– Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5)
– Sink Chest (Wooden Chest) at (-11.5, -46.5)
– Sink Inserter (Burner Inserter) at (-10.5, -46.5) with pickup at (-9.5, -46.5) and drop at (-11.5, -46.5)
– Transport Belt Connection linking the drill drop to the sink inserter pickup

### Automation Research Lab at (5.5, 5.5) with updated Electrical Connection
Consists of:
– Lab at (5.5, 5.5) (status: NO_POWER; research on Automation in progress)
– Electricity Network formed by Small Electric Poles (e.g. ElectricityGroup id=1281) connecting the lab to power sources

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
– Boiler at (8.0, 20.5) (status: NO_FUEL; fuel insertion incomplete, with “out of fuel” warnings)
– Offshore Pump at (0.5, 30.5) (status: WORKING)
– Steam Engines at:
 • (19.5, 14.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings include “not connected to power network”, “no input liquid”, “no fluid present in connections”)
 • (13.5, 17.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similarly not connected)
 • (11.5, 20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; similar warnings)
Note: Recent execution steps show multiple attempts to determine a valid placement near the Boiler’s steam output (at approximately (6.5, 20.5)) using various BuildingBox dimensions and coordinate offsets. Every candidate coordinate was rejected (can_place_entity returned False), so no additional Steam Engine has been placed.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• API Misuse and Reference Validation:
 – When invoking functions such as pickup_entity, ensure that parameters are passed in the correct order (for example, passing None as the second parameter when needed) and that entity references are valid.
 – Avoid calling a Position object as if it were a function; for instance, use buildable_area.center (or its proper method) rather than invoking center() on a Position value.

• Entity Placement Collision and Candidate Viability:
 – Always verify that the target placement coordinates are free from obstructions by using can_place_entity or an equivalent check before attempting to place an entity.
 – Repeated errors where candidate coordinates (determined via nearest_buildable or by offsetting from the Boiler’s position) are rejected (can_place_entity returned False) indicate that the BuildingBox dimensions or environmental clearance parameters may be misaligned. Adjust dimensions and recheck clearance conditions.

• Multiple Candidate Coordination:
 – When several candidate coordinates fail viability, reassess the surrounding obstructions and adjust placement search parameters (including offsets and BuildingBox dimensions) to identify an appropriate, unoccupied location.

• Pipe Connection and Alignment:
 – Ensure that pipe endpoints on the Boiler and associated Steam Engines are properly aligned. Validate fluid box connections and clear any blockages if connection attempts fail.

• Operational Consistency and Pre-Operational Checks:
 – Use standardized API calls and proper attribute access for consistent behavior.
 – Conduct comprehensive environment and inventory checks before repositioning or placement to avoid misplacement errors and repeated candidate failures.
